text: Job’s Repentance and Restoration
Then\f + \fr 42:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered Yahweh and said,
“I know that you can do all \add things\add*,
and \add any\add* scheme from you will not be thwarted.
‘Who \add is\add* this darkening counsel without knowledge?’
Therefore I uttered, but\f + \fr 42:3 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I did not understand;
⸤things too wonderful for me⸥,\f + \fr 42:3 \ft Literally “wonderful things from me” \f* but I did not know.
‘Hear and I will speak;
I will question you, then\f + \fr 42:4 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* inform me.’
By the ear’s hearing I heard \add of\add* you,
but\f + \fr 42:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* now my eye has seen you.
Therefore I despise \add myself\add*
and repent in dust and ashes.”

⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 42:7 \ft Literally “And it happened” \f* after Yahweh spoke these words to Job, Yahweh said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “⸤My wrath has been kindled⸥\f + \fr 42:7 \ft Literally “My nose became hot” \f* against you\f + \fr 42:7 \ft Singular \f* and against \add the\add* two of your friends, for you\f + \fr 42:7 \ft Plural \f* have not spoken to me what is right as my servant Job \add has\add*.

⸤So then⸥,\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Or “And now,” or “Therefore” \f* take for yourselves seven bulls and seven rams, and go to my servant Job and offer a burnt offering for yourselves. And my servant Job will pray for you,\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Plural \f* for ⸤I will certainly accept his prayer⸥,\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Literally “if his face I will lift up,” or “indeed his face I will lift up” (“if” used as an oath particle) \f* so that it will not be done with you\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Plural \f* \add according to your\add* folly, for you\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Plural \f* have not spoken to me what is right as my servant Job \add has\add*.”

So\f + \fr 42:9 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite \add and\add* Zophar the Naamathite went and did just as Yahweh had told them, and ⸤Yahweh accepted Job’s prayer⸥.\f + \fr 42:9 \ft Literally “Yahweh lifted up the face of Job” \f*

Then\f + \fr 42:10 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Yahweh returned Job’s fortune when he prayed to him on behalf of his friends. Thus\f + \fr 42:10 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Yahweh increased ⸤all that Job had twice as much as before⸥.\f + \fr 42:10 \ft Literally “all which for Job to twice” \f*

So\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* all his brothers and all his sisters and all \add those who\add* had known him ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Literally “to faces” \f* came to him, and they ate bread\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Or “food” \f* with him in his house and showed sympathy to him and comforted him for all the disaster\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Or “evil” \f* that Yahweh had brought upon him. Then\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* each one gave to him one piece of money, and each one \add gave to him\add* one ornamental ring of gold.

So\f + \fr 42:12 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Yahweh blessed Job’s latter days more than his beginning. ⸤Thus he had⸥\f + \fr 42:12 \ft Literally “And it came to be for him,” or “And it was for him” \f* fourteen thousand sheep and goats and six thousand camels and a thousand pair of oxen and a thousand female donkeys.
⸤And he had⸥\f + \fr 42:13 \ft Literally “And it came to be for him,” or “And it was for him” \f* seven sons and three daughters.
And he called the name of the first Jemimah and the name of the second Keziah and the name of the third Qeren-Happuk.
And beautiful women were not found in all the land like Job’s daughters, and their father gave to them an inheritance in the midst of their brothers.
And Job lived after this one hundred and forty years, and he saw his sons and his ⸤grandsons⸥\f + \fr 42:16 \ft Literally “the sons of his sons” \f* \add for\add* four generations.
Then\f + \fr 42:17 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job died old and full of days.
